comment.author: 31439438@N05
comment._content: The 44th Indiana Infantry (1861-1865) was organized in the Tenth Congressional District and rendezvoused at Fort Wayne, Allen County, Indiana in October, 1861. In December, the regiment left for Henderson, Kentucky. It camped at Calhoun, KY, until February, 1862, when it was transferred to Fort Henry. The 44th Indiana moved to Fort Donaldson and participated in the siege of the fort, suffering considerable loss in killed and wounded. It was engaged during both days at the battle of Shiloh. Serving throughout Kentucky, Tennessee, and Alabama, the regiment fought at Murfreesboro, Chickamauga, and Missionary Ridge. It was assigned provost duty at Chattanooga, Tennessee before being mustered out in September, 1865. Regiment lost during service 4 Officers and 76 Enlisted men killed and mortally wounded and 9 Officers and 220 Enlisted men by disease. Total 309. Source: www.indianahistory.org/library/manuscripts/collection_gui... www.civilwararchive.com/Unreghst/unininf4.htm
